intro: Primula chartacea, commonly known as the chartaceous primrose, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm, featuring hairy, oval-shaped leaves that are often bluish-green in color. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
